com.conatix.EntitySetAdder
Class LogWriter

java.lang.Object
  com.conatix.EntitySetAdder.LogWriter

public class LogWriter
extends java.lang.Object

LogWriter opens a log file and stores all the logs in a file. Each line contains the time when the log happens.

See Also:
#openLogFile()}, {@link #writeLog(String)}, {@link #closeLogFile()}

Constructor Summary

          Constructor of the class.

 void closeLogFile()
          Closes the LogFile when there is no need of storing.

Constructor Detail

LogWriter

public LogWriter(java.lang.String logFileName)
Constructor of the class. It gets the logFileName as the input and assigns it to the static variable so it can be opened and ready to use.

Parameters:
logFileName - change on command line using the argument - LogFile or in the configs.xml file log.
Method Detail

openLogFile

public void openLogFile()
Opens the LogFile and makes it ready to start writing the logs.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeLog

public void writeLog(java.lang.String logString)
Parameters:
logString - the log which should be stored in the logFileName.log. The date and time when the log happened is also stored at the beginning of each line.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

closeLogFile

public void closeLogFile()
Closes the LogFile when there is no need of storing.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
